alert.note: Alert for Fresno (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 11:52AM PST until January 09 at 2:00PM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Fresno County, including the following areas along highway 168 south of Shaver Lake. * WHEN...Until 430 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1150 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated an area of very heavy rainfall across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Trimmer Springs, Mountain Rest, Shaver Lake, Shaver Lake 3ne and Auberry. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry arroyos is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas.
